description: Change of use from office (Class B1a) to 2 no. x apartments (Class C3)
decision_conditions: The applicant has not demonstrated, on the balance of probabilities,  that the building as a whole, was in use or where vacant its last known use was one falling within Class B1(a) (offices) on 29th May 2013 as required by Schedule 2, Part 3, O.1 (b) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

The submitted proposed block plan does not show the complete site. The block plan should include whole site including building, compound, garden, neighbour's properties, main road and more.Please provide a copy of proposed block plan drawn to show the size of the drop kerb, at an identified standard metric scale (such as 1:200 or 1:500) showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan must show the direction of North and should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.
